å…è²»æˆ‘å°±å­¸ï¼Œ é¦™æ¸¯äººæ•™éƒ½æƒ³æµéŒ¢æœƒå””æœƒè«—å¤šå’—ï¼Œ ç¶²ä¸Šæœ‰nativeæ•™éƒ½å””æ”¶éŒ¢å•¦

I was watching TV and got sidetracked into browsing this forum lol. I like Japanese culture and food. I took the JLPT test at N two level last month in Tokyo. My writing far outshines my speaking so the marks I lost in speaking were offset by those I gained in writing âœğŸ¼ My friend too took the test. She’s a little weak in reading but strong in listening so the marks she gained in the listening part offset those she lost in the reading section. After the test we spent money on clothes and shoes like it was going out of fashion. We entered a casino and gambled like it was going out of fashion. If you enjoy being in Japan, you might spend money on cosmetic products and food like it’s going out of fashion. If you enter a casino you might gamble like it’s going out of fashion like we did lol My Japanese friend Keita is a marketing manager at Hilton in Tokyo. He uses photoshop every day for poster and banner designs as it’s worth its weight in gold in digital marketing. The party poster he designed for the hotel is fabulous. The gold words are clearly defined on the black background. I admire him for his ambition and fierce determination to succeed. He never gets sidetracked by personal issues. In addition, he enjoys debate. Last week he wiped the floor with all opposition during a debate about the existence of god. It was impressive. His great great grandfather ğŸ‘´ğŸ» was a violinist during the romantic period who started by performing in salons and then progressed to big concert halls. His elder brother started off his career as a junior accountant in a local accounting firm and progressed to an accounting manager in an international firm. I had a nice chat with him yesterday. We started off by discussing his career plans and gradually the conversation progressed to our favourite movies lol His younger brother started off as a security guard but quickly progressed to a manager. I enjoy chatting with him but whenever we chat we never seem to progress beyond his favourite sport, baseball. He loves painting but alas he has no talent as a painter. It never really progressed beyond the stage of painting cartoon characters lol By the way Keita will be giving a house party next Sunday but alas I can’t attend as I got work to do.

replies.msg: my friend Sarah is doing a phd in Japanese Literature at Tokyo university since today a master's isn't worth the paper it's written on let alone a bachelor degree. Last Thursday she was almost swindled out of thousands of dollars. I told her that person was a scammer who was trying to swindle money from her. The contract isn't worth the paper its printed on. Fortunately she listened to me. Otherwise the scammer would've swindled her out of thousands of dollars. I've read in the newspapersğŸ“° that some customers were promised to get their money ğŸ’°back if they weren't happy with the products. Later they found out that they had been sold down the river as they have been unable to contact the scammer to date. Yesterday Sarah dropped a dumbbell and put a dent in my chair. I said I would wipe her slate clean if she fixed the dent in my chairğŸ¤£ Her sister sometimes takes a nap during lunchtime because she has so much work to do that she feels drained. She usually snoozes on the sofa or at her desk by the fireplace when everybody else'searing lunch outside. She once brought her work along with her to a library where she dozed off at the table. Having a nap especially in front of the fire is a marvelous way to recharge your energy though. Her brother has just completed his phd at Osaka university and is on the way to becoming a professor. Japan is on the way to becoming the world's strongest economy.
